H0.text: Electromagnetic waves are transverse waves, a property that makes it possible to use them to transmit information between a space shuttle and NASA mission control centers on the ground.

H1.text: Electromagnetic waves have very low velocity, which allows them to be used to transmit information between a space shuttle and NASA mission control centers on the ground.

H2.text: Electromagnetic waves are all visible to human eyes, which is the property that makes it possible to use these waves to transmit information between a space shuttle and NASA mission control centers on the ground.

H3.text: Electromagnetic waves can travel through a vacuum, which is the property that makes it possible to transmit information between a space shuttle and NASA mission control centers on the ground.

A4.text: In empty space (vacuum), electromagnetic radiation travels at the speed of light, c, 299,792,458 meters per second (approximately 186,000 miles per second).

A5.text: Electromagnetic radiation encompasses a broad spectrum, classified by frequency, ranging from radio waves, microwaves, infrared, visible light, ultraviolet, X-rays, to gamma rays.
